alert.note: Alert for Natrona (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 10 at 9:20PM MDT until May 14 at 8:00AM MDT by NWS Riverton
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 115 AM MDT THURSDAY... * WHAT...Small stream flooding caused by earlier excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...The South Fork of Castle Creek and Salt Creek upstream of Midwest and Edgerton. * WHEN...Until 115 AM MDT. * IMPACTS...The South Fork of Castle Creek and Salt Creek upstream of Midwest and Edgerton will likely run high this evening into tonight, and these creeks could overflow their banks. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 902 PM MDT, flooding remains a threat. Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms between 5 PM and 7 PM. Radar estimated between 1.5 and 3.5 inches of rain fell in the South Fork Castle Creek drainage. - This includes the following streams and drainages... Bothwell Draw, Casper Creek, Teapot Creek, McKenzie Draw, Castle Creek, East Fork Horse Ranch Creek, Middle Fork Casper Creek, Stove Gulch, Cottonwood Creek, North Cottonwood Creek, North Fork Casper Creek, Salt Creek, South Fork Castle Creek, Horse Ranch Creek, Alkali Creek and East Teapot Creek. - Some locations that may experience high flows in creeks include... Midwest and Edgerton.
info.instruction: Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. In hilly terrain there are hundreds of low water crossings which are potentially dangerous in heavy rain. Do not attempt to cross flooded roads.
